citation.article-title: Paenibacillus borealis sp. nov., a nitrogen-fixing species isolated from spruce forest humus in Finland.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus borealis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus borealis (bo.re.a'lis. M.L. adj. borealis pertaining to the north (wind), boreal)
Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic, motile rods (0.75-1.0 μm in width, 3.0-5.0 μm in length).
Ellipsoidal spores formed in swollen sporangia in the subterminal or terminal region of the cell.
The mature spores of the type strain have a motif of stripes on the surface.
Flat, smooth, opaque and entire colonies on nutrient agar.
The temperature range for growth is 5-37 °C; optimum is 28 °C.
Grows at pH 5.6-8.0; optimum is pH 7.
Does not tolerate 5% NaCl, 0.001% lysozyme or 0.02% sodium azide.
Catalase is produced.
Oxidase-negative.
Litmus milk reaction acidic.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Nitrogen is fixed.
Acetylmethylcarbinol, indole or dihydroxyacetone are not produced.
Casein, carboxymethyl cellulose, chitin, pectin and egg yolk lecithin are hydrolysed.
Starch is not hydrolysed.
Gelatin is not liquefied.
Acid and gas are produced from carbohydrates.
Acid is produced from glycerol, D-xylose, methyl β-xyloside, N-acetylglucosamine, lactose, inulin, melezitose and D-arabitol.
D-Arabinose, ribose, rhamnose, inositol, methyl α-D-mannoside, D-fucose, L-fucose and gluconate are not fermented.
Aesculin and bis-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate are hydrolysed.

The following compounds are assimilated: N-acetyl-dglucosamine, L-arabinose, p-arbutin, D-cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, gluconate, D-glucose, D-mannose, D-maltose, D-sucrose, salicin, D-trehalose and D-xylose.

The following compounds are not hydrolysed: p-nitrophenyl-β-D-galactopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl-phenyl-phosphonate, p-nitrophenyl-phosphoryl-choline and 2-deoxythymidine-5'-p-nitrophenyl phosphate.

The following compounds are not assimilated: L-rhamnose, adonitol, i-inositol, acetate, cis-aconitate, citrate, fumarate, oxoglutarate, pyruvate, L-alanine, L-aspartate, L-leucine, 3-hydroxybenzoate and 4-hydroxybenzoate.
The G+­C content of the type strain is 53.6 mol%.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15:0, iso-C15:0, C14:0 and C16:0.
The relative amounts of straight-chain C14:0 and C16:0 are nearly equal for cells grown at 28 °C.
Isolated from acid humus in Norway spruce forest in Finland and from rhizoplane of birch and red fescue.
KK19T (=DSM 13188T=CCUG 43137T) is the type strain of the species.
